conclusion: Identify the time intervals and velocities for both cars.
Car A: From 0s to 10s, velocity increases linearly from 0 m/s to 40 m/s. From 10s to 30s, velocity remains constant at 40 m/s.
Car B: From 0s to 10s, velocity increases linearly from 0 m/s to 40 m/s. From 10s to 30s, velocity continues to increase linearly.
Calculate the distance traveled by Car A from 0s to 10s as 200 m.
Calculate the distance traveled by Car B from 0s to 10s as 200 m.
Compare the distances traveled by both cars from 0s to 10s; both traveled 200 m.
Determine the position of the cars at 10s; they are side by side.
Final Answer: At t=10s, Car A is neither ahead of nor behind Car B; they are side by side.
